mods.note: dates tentatively as 1855. On p. 8 of text, August 1855 is mentioned as date of writing of Longstreet's second letter. General Note: Longstreet's letters are in opposition to the 'Know-Nothing' movement. First letter is addressed to preachers of the Methodist Church South. Contents: Letters from President Longstreet -- The alien and sedition laws and Virginia and Kentucky resolutions of 1798 and 1799 -- The Democratic platform, as adopted by the Baltimore convention, June 5, 1852.
politics; nativism; American Party; unionism; southern nationalism

titleInfo.title: Civil War Context and Conflict at LSU Libraries
